title: Samsung Galaxy S8 to reportedly feature Windows Continuum-like desktop experience
text:
Samsung Galaxy S8 to reportedly feature Windows Continuum-like desktop experience Samsung Galaxy S8 to reportedly feature Windows Continuum-like desktop experience By - January 3, 2017 “The Galaxy S8 will reportedly let you attach a monitor, keyboard, and mouse to offer full-fledged desktop experience” 
It appears that Samsung is planning to bring Windows Continuum-like functionality to Android with the Galaxy S8. According to an alleged leaked presentation slide, the upcoming Galaxy S8 will allow you to use the phone as a desktop by attaching a monitor, keyboard, and mouse. It’s worth mentioning that Microsoft was the first to introduce this functionality with Windows 10 Mobile. As per the leaked slide, the Korean tech giant’s Continuum-like feature will be called ‘Samsung Desktop Experience’. The image shows a Samsung phone connected to a monitor, a wireless keyboard, and a mouse. The monitor will be connected to the device via a cable, while the keyboard and mouse will be paired via Bluetooth. Image credit – Deviantart 
This feature on the Samsung Galaxy S8 will give you an extended workspace, with a full desktop experience alongside multi-window multi-tasking. Like most leaks, this one should be taken with a pinch of salt. Samsung is expected to unveil the Galaxy S8 at an event in April.
